did.abstract: This collection includes various materials documenting the activities of the Brooklyn Baptist Social Union during the period 1869 to 1898, including proceedings of the Union's Executive Board, correspondence, a minute book and roll of members, loose minutes and reports, a scrapbook of clippings on the 1874 national convention, and various news clippings, programs, and notices.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of William R. Dorman, 1936 and 1937.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn Baptist Social Union was organized in 1868 as a lay organization promoting Baptist values. In December of 1874 the Union organized a national convention of all Baptist social unions, held at at the Brooklyn Athenaeum, to promote the instruction of the laity.
